means: 思想体系上，意识形态上

sentence.Network_en: The army was ideologically opposed to the kind of economic solution proposed.
sentence.Network_cn: 军方从意识形态角度出发反对所提议的经济方案。

sentence.Network_en: Ideologically, there was nothing in common between them.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们在思想观念上格格不入。
在思想意识上, 他们之间有许多不同之处.

PerfectNetExp.abs: ideologically , we do not see eye to eye .在意识形态上我们意见不一致。

actually , there are bound to be some who ideologically will always be reluctant to accept Marxism-Leninism and communism . we should not be too exacting in what we demand of them ;事实上必定会有一些人在思想上始终不愿意接受马克思列宁主义，不愿意接受共产主义，对于这一部分人不要苛求；

at the same time , I also constantly improve their own cultivation , regularly reading newspapers and some famous , tolerant , sincere treat everyone and ideologically have been self-improvement .与此同时，我也不断的提高自身的修养，定期的阅读报刊和一些名著，宽容的，真诚的对待每个人，从思想上得到了自我提高。
ideologically , they have many differences .在思想意识上，他们之间有许多不同之处。

entry.tran: 思想体系的;意识形态的;观念形态的
entry.def: Ideological means relating to principles or beliefs.

example.ex: Others left the party for ideological reasons...
example.tran: 其他人由于意识形态原因而脱党。

example.ex: The ideological divisions between the parties aren't always obvious.
example.tran: 政党之间的意识形态界线并不总是泾渭分明的。

sentences.sentence: "ideologically, we do not see eye to eye"

auth_sentence.content: Many advisers remain ideologically in favour of active funds.
auth_sentence.res_content: Many advisers remain ideologically in favour of active funds.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Many advisers remain ideologically in favour of active funds.

auth_sentence.content: How much of a wild card is she ideologically?
auth_sentence.res_content: How much of a wild card is she ideologically?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: How much of a wild card is she ideologically?

auth_sentence.content: Ideologically, the three parties are not close.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ideologically, the three parties are not close.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ideologically, the three parties are not close.

Sentence.sentence: Contrast this middle path with America and Europe, which have each gone ideologically over-board in their own ways.

During the presidential campaign, Barack Obama assembled a racially and ideologically diverse coalition with his message of hope and change; as the reality of life under a new administration settles in, some of those supporters might become disillusioned.
Young people in America are now more diverse ideologically
